alert.note: Alert for Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 5:05AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Baker, northeastern Columbia, southeastern Ware and south central Charlton Counties through 545 AM EST... At 504 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Taylor, or 16 miles south of Fargo, moving northeast at 55 mph. This storm is showing some rotation. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Baker, northeastern Columbia, southeastern Ware and south central Charlton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EST for northern Florida. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 AM EST for northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.
